commit 1ed0f691ba2922eaf77055b7f5bea901def2ec13
Author: zor-el <13865072+zor-el@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Mon Feb 17 23:44:34 2025 +0100

    expand tests to include tilde-prefixed lib dirs
    
    By modding ENV['HOME'| we can have expand_path('~/lib')
    return the same absolute path as expand_path('lib').
    With this, we can simply reuse the tests for 'lib'
    to test the behavior for '~/lib'.

commit c373f7241d1327788da4dcb1e4e27726514ad2d2
Merge: f8c3bddfd fde96fd61

commit fde96fd619d46a954448dfe3f9161eaf669334e8
Merge: 603c41b2b b55ee1544
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Tue Feb 18 07:41:06 2025 +0100

    Merge pull request #1730 from nanoc/denis/rm-ruby-version
    
    Git-ignore .ruby-version

commit b55ee1544f44b16d6652ba7c9f6d7b9d2401c3d8
Author: Denis Defreyne <git@denisdefreyne.com>
Date:   Tue Feb 18 07:36:52 2025 +0100

    Git-ignore .ruby-version
    
    Nanoc supports multiple Ruby versions (as specified by the `required_ruby_version` property of the individual gemspec files), and so it does not make sense to lock to a single Ruby version. You can still create your own .ruby-version file locally; it just won’t be (and shouldn’t be) committed.

commit 3e439b02bd3c23fd8cca094f3f3e2923c5f899a3
Author: zor-el <13865072+zor-el@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Jan 1 20:47:44 2025 +0100

    expand `commands_dirs` paths to allow '~/my/nanoc/commands'
    
    Without this, nanoc.yaml would have to contain absolute paths,
    which is both less portable and less privacy-preserving.
    
    This behavior is in line with that in the filesystem data source.

commit df8858280f413be3b049901739f6625c22efb3fe
Author: zor-el <13865072+zor-el@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Jan 1 20:42:20 2025 +0100

    expand `lib_dirs` paths to allow '~/my/nanoc/lib'
    
    Without this, nanoc.yaml would have to contain absolute paths,
    which is both less portable and less privacy-preserving.
    
    This behavior is in line with that in the filesystem data source.

commit bb603a32c1612645e485fe3f7ba814c4f584546e
Merge: 7c497e556 c37e8c74b
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Thu Apr 4 15:41:33 2024 +0200

    Merge pull request #1693 from nanoc/denis/faster-checksummer
    
    Make Checksummer faster and more correct

commit c37e8c74b58336bec193ea58ef578ddd55c9f56f
Author: Denis Defreyne <git@denisdefreyne.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 4 14:35:04 2024 +0200

    Make Checksummer faster and more correct
    
    The new implementation is faster because of two reasons:
    
    - It more aggressively avoids calculating checksums of already-calculated items
    - It effectfully updates a hash rather than using Immutable::Set
    
    It is also more correct because it replaces use of <recur> with a numerical reference to a previously-seen object.
    
    Each newly checksummed object will have a number suffix, e.g.
    `Array#5<…>`. Each previously seen object will have an @-reference, e.g.
    `Array#9<@4,@5,>`.
    
    This will invalidate existing stored checksums in Nanoc sites, but it is unavoidable and worth the tradeoff.

commit 7c497e5565d6b395a6c66b75134e7d45857f06e7

Author: Denis Defreyne <git@denisdefreyne.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 8 09:24:48 2023 +0100

commit b559cc4d1000bbfde0b17983dbcee33a5b89ae62
Author: Denis Defreyne <git@denisdefreyne.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 8 09:24:22 2023 +0100

    Fix style

commit 0293e50ca251cb31bb1191d71a5dd1a7d9f38b4b
Author: Junichi Sato <22004610+sato11@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Thu Nov 30 11:23:23 2023 +0900

    Set metadata source_code_uri
    
    This commit adds 'source_code_uri' key to gemspec's metadata,
    which makes nanoc and the plugins compatible with
    [gem-src](https://rubygems.org/gems/gem-src)'s functionality:
    without it there is no way to detect the source repo
    unless actually opening the homepage and navigate through it,
    which I believe is rather tedious.
    
    The 'source_code_uri' item in gemspec's metadata is described in
    [the guideline rubygems.org publishes](https://guides.rubygems.org/specification-reference/#metadata),
    and it is
    [what gem-src uses to prioritize when inferring which repo to clone](https://github.com/amatsuda/gem-src/blob/v0.10.2/lib/rubygems_plugin.rb#L38).

commit df44f37cb66a98aeedda66d57130a1ff6a546cb1
Author: zor-el <13865072+zor-el@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 29 23:08:04 2023 +0100

    Add `aliases: true` to all YAML.safe_load calls

commit b0f690e4fb2365ed4d37ae4287aaf8e274bd7d2c
Author: zor-el <13865072+zor-el@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 29 20:55:05 2023 +0100

    Allows YAML anchors/aliases in nanoc configuration again.
    (Fix for configuration-breaking change)
    
    Fixes breaking changes in YAML processing, [Issue #1676]
    
    [Issue #1676]: https://github.com/nanoc/nanoc/issues/1676
    
    Broken upstream with Psych 4 (https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/17866) and reinforced in Nanoc with [PR 1583](https://github.com/nanoc/nanoc/pull/1583), commit `8882be18101315c7c65ee88dded328d3d44b30db`.
    
    #### Details
    
    Psych 4 has introduced a [severe breaking change](https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/17866) - YAML anchors and aliases are no longer recognized by default.
    
    Nanoc enforces Psych >= 4 since [PR 1583](https://github.com/nanoc/nanoc/pull/1583), commit `8882be18101315c7c65ee88dded328d3d44b30db`. This prevents `gem 'psych', '<4'` as first aid in one's own Gemfile.
    
    Net result: All `nanoc.yaml` configurations and content front matters that make use of anchors are since broken.

Merge: 6e7a47ed4 87508f241

    Re-design outdatedness of dependencies on collections

commit 87508f241aba02f3f41978d4be559ce8644f7dbf
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Wed Oct 5 21:53:34 2022 +0200

    Rework outdatedness of collections
    
    This changes the outdatedness checker so that item/layout collections themselves are not considered “outdated” anymore. Instead, a new `ItemAdded`/`LayoutAdded` rule exist now, which marks newly added items and layouts as outdated.
    
    The `#dependency_causes_outdatedness?` method now carries the logic of determining whether a dependency causes outdatedness because new items are added into item/layout collections.

commit 299a1ec6f32194593162b092f139ed03dad62242
Author: Daniel Aleksandersen <code@daniel.priv.no>
Date:   Tue Apr 26 06:49:26 2022 +0200

    Allow same Yaml classes for bin. and frontmatter
    
    Psych-4.0 changes to safe_load by default. The DateClass isn’t allowed
    in safe_load mode. Nanoc expects it to be for e.g. created_at.
    Duplicating code from parser.b to allow same classes in all Yaml
    source files and front matter.

commit a7c6207e6766ca605ab8df8e6ffc2b649e2cccad
Author: naveensrinivasan <172697+naveensrinivasan@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 6 18:22:56 2022 +0000

    Set permissions for GitHub actions
    
    - Included permissions for the action. https://github.com/ossf/scorecard/blob/main/docs/checks.md#token-permissions
    
    https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#permissions
    
    https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-jobs/assigning-permissions-to-jobs
    
    [Keeping your GitHub Actions and workflows secure Part 1: Preventing pwn requests](https://securitylab.github.com/research/github-actions-preventing-pwn-requests/)
    
    > Restrict the GitHub token permissions only to the required ones; this way, even if the attackers will succeed in compromising your workflow, they won’t be able to do much.
    
    https://www.legitsecurity.com/blog/github-privilege-escalation-vulnerability
    
    Signed-off-by: naveensrinivasan <172697+naveensrinivasan@users.noreply.github.com>

commit 3951e605e94318cc2e542d06b8b22144a1f8728f
Author: Sergio Durigan Junior <sergiodj@sergiodj.net>
Date:   Fri Jan 28 13:50:15 2022 -0500

    Use 'compact' on 'Socket.getifaddrs.map'
    
    In certain situations, when a TUN device is present (e.g., when a VPN
    is connected), `Socket.getifaddrs.map(&:addr)` can contain one or more
    `nil` elements.  This can lead to errors like the following:
    
    (irb):6:in `select': undefined method `ipv4?' for nil:NilClass (NoMethodError)
            from (irb):6:in `<main>'
            from /usr/lib/ruby/gems/3.0.0/gems/irb-1.3.5/exe/irb:11:in `<top (required)>'
            from /usr/bin/irb3.0:23:in `load'
            from /usr/bin/irb3.0:23:in `<main>'
    
    This commit prevents such errors by using `compact` to remove any
    `nil` elements from the map before passing it to `select`.
    
    Signed-off-by: Sergio Durigan Junior <sergiodj@sergiodj.net>

commit a69729a6015b00d272d308be3c09c32d3700d0aa

Date:   Thu Dec 31 11:46:39 2020 +0100

    Disable contracts on Ruby 3.x
    
    The contracts.ruby gem appears to be incompatible with Ruby 3.x, and its future is unclear as it’s unmaintained. Therefore, it’ll be disabled on Ruby 3.x, and perhaps in the future Nanoc can make use of Ruby 3.x’s built-in static typing support.

    Make clonefile optional
    
    clonefile fails to build on Netlify:
    
        clonefile.c:47:58: error: ‘FICLONE’ undeclared
    
    … which is unexpected, but because this is a regression, Nanoc can now work without clonefile as well (and only making use of it when it’s available).

Date:   Wed Jun 17 14:42:23 2020 +0800

commit cb8bcee65bd9370cb935ba12fc6d5c877a5b4481
Author: Ethan Crawford <ethan_jc@hotmail.com>
Date:   Tue Jun 16 15:03:02 2020 +0800

    nanoc-cli: Only try to clean UTF-8 chars from UTF-8 strings
    
    Previously, when attempting to load a custom filter in a Windows Nanoc
    installation, Nanoc was crashing with indications that the UTF-8 stream cleaner
    was unable to process the supplied string.
    Now, we only attempt to clean UTF-8 characters out of the string if it is UTF-8
    encoded.
    
    Should fix #1502. (Including the contracts gem issue).

commit b492a37e748fb7ac28f15bbd2ae244eade69f696
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Fri Mar 6 21:53:56 2020 +0100

    Fix: Handle non-array keys when loading checksums
    
    An exception was triggered on `key.first`, because not all keys are arrays (tuples). This exception would cause Store#load to delete the (presumed broken) checksums file, causing some checksusm to be nil, and therefore causing some items to be outdated.
    
    Fixes #1471

commit 13a55184a87a1945ebb77ab99ff5eadc28328c58
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Tue Jan 21 08:57:23 2020 +0100

    Remove safe_level support in ERB
    
    $SAFE_LEVEL and ERB’s safe_level parameter are deprecated and will be removed in Ruby 3. For Nanoc, keeping it around doesn’t make sense, as it’s not working properly anymore anyway, and it’s not useful for Nanoc.

    Set version to 4.11.13

commit 31adc6b318704f4889e33a69728ac5a1c2c99c62
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sat Nov 2 12:55:38 2019 +0100

    Read files as UTF-8 for diff generation
    
    Nanoc always writes output files in UTF-8, so when reading them, they need to be interpreted as UTF-8 as well. Otherwise, depending on the default external encoding, the diff generation might fail later on (confusingly, on Windows, it just locks up the Ruby process -- no exception).
    
    This change lacks a test case (for now), as I don’t see a way of testing this now.

commit 0694f68e2dd53bb0fda84c6a3ade19d33f1f18a8
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Fri Nov 1 08:44:12 2019 +0100

    Add timestamps to log messages

commit cd00023fdab0e79758dce12a7f6e29d29276e6c6
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Fri Nov 1 08:44:01 2019 +0100

    Add missing logger require to nanoc-cli

commit a1ba3ec0deeb36a738c5c527805a276a5512487c
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 19:24:19 2019 +0200

    Fix nanoc-cli build
    
    It turns out that nanoc-cli was not being tested at all, which explains why I was so successful in setting it up.
    
    Unfortunately, fixing it was not trivial, and so this single commit contains a handful of unrelated changes:
    
    * Turn on nanoc-cli tests
    
    * Merge Nanoc::Spec into common/. nanoc-cli needs to use it, and it’d require a dependency onto nanoc, which is not what we want.
    
    * ShowPlugins (part of nanoc-cli) no longer knows about Deployer, but there is now support for adding custom plugin classes to ShowPlugins.
    
    * ShowRules is moved from nanoc-cli back to nanoc, because it requires knowledge of the rules DSL, which is not part of nanoc-cli or nanoc-core.
    
    This isn’t the way I intend to make changes, and I’d rather have rolled back, but in this case I felt that rolling back would have been difficult and not have gained us as much as rolling forward. Consider this commit very much an exception to the rule, though.

commit b21a5db3db2c99892c614f4f75925c3974762206
Merge: bda846f71 51adcc39e
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis@denis.ws>
Date:   Sat Sep 7 20:33:09 2019 +0200

    Merge pull request #1456 from nanoc/fix-diff-generation
    
    Prevent race condition in diff generation

commit 51adcc39ec49783eae209aadc771892d6d88c34c
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sat Sep 7 20:21:12 2019 +0200

    Prevent race condition in diff generation
    
    The call to `Nanoc::Core::NotificationCenter.sync` helped avoid some issues, but it is still possible for the diff generation to fail because the original file is no longer available. This happens because `.sync` unblocks as soon as the last notification is picked up, rather than when the last notification is finished.

commit bda846f7107f69df7c9acca36a5cc90aae346774
Merge: 975a011e6 61c9afa4d
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis@denis.ws>
Date:   Sat Sep 7 19:42:01 2019 +0200

    Merge pull request #1455 from nanoc/faster-safer-diff
    
    Make diffs faster and more correct

commit 61c9afa4df443e6f8db254c8510a92d05fc87c92
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sat Sep 7 19:28:14 2019 +0200

    Make diffs faster and more correct
    
    By using Diff::LCS directly, we avoid unnecessary file writes. Additionally, we can assume that the diff is generated for textual files (determined by Nanoc), and avoid TTY::File’s in-this-case annoying decision to not handle seemingly-binary files.

commit df9d119676258c780c2521012ae79baf1883d267
Merge: 11526a6f2 91cd15413
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis@denis.ws>
Date:   Sun Aug 11 20:39:27 2019 +0200

    Merge pull request #1438 from nanoc/common-exclude-files
    
    Allow specifying excluded files across all checks

commit 91cd154138df2aaeb76b67bba4f62426ce243165
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sat May 18 09:48:01 2019 +0200

    Allow specifying excluded files across all checks
    
    This allows specifying files to exclude across all checks. Previously, each check had its own way to specify files to exclude.
    
    To exclude certain files, list then under the `exclude_files` property, under the `all` property of `checks`, e.g.
    
    ```
    checks:
      all:
        exclude_files:
          - bad.html
          - worse.html
    ```
    
    Closes nanoc/features#51.

    Switch LinkCollector to work with URIs and collect more of them
    
    * Support area, base, blockquote, object, and source elements.
    * Support srcset attribute on img and source elements (for responsive images).
    * Support ping attribute on a and area elements.
    * Support poster attribute on the video element.
    * Support cite attribute on the blockquote element.
    * Support HTML+RDFa global about and resource attributes.

commit f41a25626df915415c720f1c6278fe5b7a51ba10
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sat Apr 27 13:38:31 2019 +0200

    Upgrade Zeitwerk
    
    The upgrade isn’t straightforward, because the way Nanoc Core was set up wasn’t entirely following Zeitwerk’s philosophy:
    
    - nanoc-core.rb doesn’t define anything useful. For this reason, it’s now explicitly ignored in Zeitwerk; otherwise, it’d assume that it defines NanocCore (based on the filename)
    - nanoc/core.rb is supposed to define Nanoc::Core (based on the filename). It didn’t explicitly do that, which was probably fine because of the #requires at the bottom of the file, but now it’s explicit
    
    Also see https://github.com/fxn/zeitwerk/issues/45, especially @fxn’s comment, for details.

commit 93008ff60bda7125f886b828d7ccb84d1b856b99

Date:   Sat Apr 27 11:08:19 2019 +0200

    This removes references to Nanoc::Int::Errors::Generic.

commit 39b827fbb468f4140e7ee9c31fe14625e855ebb8
Author: Daniel Aleksandersen <code@daniel.priv.no>
Date:   Sat Apr 27 02:47:29 2019 +0200

    Treat permanent redirects as errors
    
    Report permanently redirected links as errors. In accordance with RFC 7538 and RFC 7231: Requests to permanently redirected URLs should not be repeated and the link should be updated to point to the new location not be repeated and the links should be updated.

commit 7410fed8a9fdcb3d8e7e72ef6825d1d1f01bdbff
Merge: e3a75e2ce f0a8a6a5e
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis@denis.ws>
Date:   Sat Apr 27 09:11:51 2019 +0200

    Merge pull request #1417 from da2x/patch-2
    
    Set a User-Agent for HTTP requests from :elinks

commit f0a8a6a5e75b376c44f3f6c1c61be4d165fcef8b
Author: Daniel Aleksandersen <code@daniel.priv.no>
Date:   Sat Apr 27 02:10:28 2019 +0200

    Set a User-Agent for HTTP requests from :elinks
    
    Goals:
    * The default “Ruby” User-Agent is blocked everywhere so replace it.
    * Include “Mozilla/5.0” to pass through a lot of blocking filters and because it’s required due to the legacy of the web.
    * Include Nanoc software name and version to identify the software making the request.
    * Describe the purpose of the request to help webmasters make informed blocking decisions.

commit dbd6af6174a934f5bef079c9b64cd88c3f87ad9a
Author: Gregory Pakosz <gregory.pakosz@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Oct 6 16:26:15 2018 +0200

    Added nanoc() sass custom function
    
    Example usage, from within sass code:
    
    @if nanoc('@config.dig(:items, :headings, :auto_number)') {
       body { counter-reset: h2; }
       h2 { counter-reset: h3; }
       h3 { counter-reset: h4; }
       h4 { counter-reset: h5; }
       h5 { counter-reset: h6; }
    
       h2:before { counter-increment: h2; content: counter(h2) ". "; }
       h3:before { counter-increment: h3; content: counter(h2) "." counter(h3) ". "; }
       h4:before { counter-increment: h4; content: counter(h2) "." counter(h3) "." counter(h4) ". "; }
       h5:before { counter-increment: h5; content: counter(h2) "." counter(h3) "." counter(h4) "." counter(h5) ". "; }
       h6:before { counter-increment: h6; content: counter(h2) "." counter(h3) "." counter(h4) "." counter(h5) "." counter(h6) ". "; }
    
       h2.nocount:before, h3.nocount:before, h4.nocount:before, h5.nocount:before, h6.nocount:before { content: ""; counter-increment: none; }
    }
    
    Or even,
    
    .title {
      color: nanoc('@config[:title][:color]', $unquote: true)
    }

commit 97e025e41ded0974fa97115cbf46c5ff4c4cb4cd
Author: Gregory Pakosz <gregory.pakosz@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Oct 6 16:26:15 2018 +0200

    Implemented new :sass and :sass_sourcemap filters
    
    This commit introduces a Nanoc aware Sass importer that:
      - does not rely on monkey patching Sass Filesystem importer implementation
      - reasons about items instead of file which means:
        - you can import by identifier
        - you can import by pattern
        - you can import in memory and/or filtered items

commit 8a8bb28847e2ced57df3cbeddb893107e57a8656
Author: Thomas Hochstein <thh@inter.net>
Date:   Wed Oct 3 17:33:27 2018 +0200

    Add title_proc parameter to blogging helper.
    
    title_proc can be used to transform the title of each
    item in an Atom feed, like content_proc or excerpt_proc
    do for content or excerpt.
    
    Closes nanoc/features#42
    
    Signed-off-by: Thomas Hochstein <thh@inter.net>

commit 017dd439ebdec4a60fa55daa51a352f71ecfe67f
Author: Antonio Terceiro <terceiro@softwarelivre.org>
Date:   Thu Feb 22 21:58:02 2018 -0300

    Optimize the handling of binary items
    
    When writing large binary items (e.g. audio or video files), creating a
    hard link pointing to the original avoids duplicating the data on disk.
    This is specially useful for large binary items.
    
    Hard linking will fail when the source file is not on the same device as
    the output directory (e.g. when /tmp is a tmpfs). In that case, fallback
    to the previous behavior of copying, what does duplicate the space, but
    should always work.

commit 719f2a4a9941e65ada4c982ec4090547914e1105
Author: Ian Young <ian@iay.org.uk>
Date:   Sun Feb 11 12:07:20 2018 +0000

    Add unit tests for atom_feed :id and :alt_link options

commit ca22ae37f4e90a7a4c3620a7736a2e71a391db87
Author: Ian Young <ian@iay.org.uk>
Date:   Wed Jan 24 18:18:38 2018 +0000

    Improve flexibility of Atom feed generator
    
    Adds two new parameters, :alt_link and :id, to the atom_feed method.
    These allow the overriding of the <id> and <link rel="alternate">
    elements of the generated Atom feed.
    
    Overriding these can result in greater compatibility and also allow for
    the possibility of multiple feeds per site.

Date:   Sun Oct 1 12:00:39 2017 +0200

    Refactor: Reduce state through #run_until_* methods
    
    These methods return data that has been computed. This way, it’s impossible to access this data until after it’s been computed, reducing complexity and the risk of accessing this state at the wrong time.

commit 6029162013444cf980bfa22801c0ab2af9f0638b
Author: A. Cynic <chris@mretc.net>
Date:   Sat Apr 29 16:49:28 2017 -0600

    Include xml:base attribute on feed element
    
    The 'xml:base' attribute is used by feed readers to resolve relative
    URLs in the feed content. Without it, relative URLs in feeds generator
    by nanoc are broken.

commit eedd9a26caee35846b7e853c1a9e334df9bb5b38
Author: Remi Barraquand <dev@remibarraquand.com>
Date:   Tue May 31 15:25:59 2016 +0200

    Support nanoc environments
    
    Introduce basic support for nanoc environment:
    - nanoc command is updated to include --env argument
    - config are overriden using the active environment if any
    - unless define in environment, output_dir is {{output_dir}}/{{env_name}}
    
    Setting environments is done in nanoc.yaml using the `environments` property.
    Example usage is:
    
    ```
    output_dir: output
    
    environments:
      default: &default
        base_url: ...
        ...
      development:
        <<: *default
        base_url: ...
      production:
        <<: *default
        base_url: ...
      yet_another_env:
        <<: *default
        base_url: ...
        output_dir: build
    ```
    
    Selecting working environment can be done:
    - using environment variable `NANOC_ENVIRONMENT`
    - using `nanoc --env=[<value>]`

commit 2643931feee7aeea9e99b552178db537facfb677
Author: whitequark <whitequark@whitequark.org>
Date:   Wed Jul 13 16:26:30 2016 +0000

    Discover external commands through Bundler
    
    Other gems may want to add commands to the nanoc CLI. To do this
    they need to run Nanoc::CLI.add_after_setup_proc. Currently, there
    is no way to hook into the CLI. This commit adds such a way by
    utilizing Bundler. E.g. the gem guard-nanoc could introduce new
    commands when added to the Gemfile in this way:
    
      gem 'nanoc'
      group :nanoc do
        gem 'guard-nanoc'
      end
    
    Presence of any gems in the group :nanoc will cause the library with
    the same name as the gem to be required by Bundler during
    the initialization of the CLI.
    
    A special group :nanoc is used for two reasons:
      * nanoc may not be the only or primary user of the Gemfile,
        and requiring many unrelated gems will slow down every invocation
        of nanoc with no workaround;
      * existing Gemfiles may include specifications for gems that cannot
        be successfully required, so using the group :default would
        break such existing nanoc installations.

commit b916159cc15b5987cd9590c21850ce998a7e3f98
Author: Micha Rosenbaum <micha@rosetree.de>
Date:   Tue Mar 22 22:33:41 2016 +0100

    Raise a better error when no String is given in #html_escape
    
    Nanoc::Helpers::HTMLEscape#html_escape breaks when the given parameter
    is not a String.
    
    The following message appeared:
    
    ~~~~~
    Captain! We’ve been hit!
    
    Message:
    NoMethodError: undefined method `gsub' for 1:Fixnum
    
    Stack trace:
    0. […]/nanoc-4.1.4/lib/nanoc/helpers/html_escape.rb:38:in `html_escape'
    1. […]/nanoc-4.1.4/lib/nanoc/helpers/link_to.rb:59:in `block in link_to'
    2. […]/nanoc-4.1.4/lib/nanoc/helpers/link_to.rb:58:in `each'
    3. […]/nanoc-4.1.4/lib/nanoc/helpers/link_to.rb:58:in `reduce'
    4. […]/nanoc-4.1.4/lib/nanoc/helpers/link_to.rb:58:in `link_to'
    5. layout /default/:84:in `block in render'
    ~~~~~
    
    After I tried something similar to the following:
    
    ~~~~~ruby
    link_to 'Homepage', @items['/'].path, {accesskey: 1}
    ~~~~~~
    
    To fix this issue I had multiple ideas:
    
    I first wanted to use `value.to_s` in the Nanoc Helper link_to
    (currently on line 59). But it is not garanteed, that `to_s` results in
    a useful output.
    
    https://github.com/nanoc/nanoc/blob/master/lib/nanoc/helpers/link_to.rb#L59
    
    My second thought was to use `string.to_s` in #html_escape, `unless
    string.is_a? String`. But again, it is not clear, if the result is what
    the user expected.
    
    So I came up with my third idea, to raise a RuntimeError with slightly
    more helpful error message. This commit adds an error message, that
    points the user to the origin of his error. Using the stack trace, it
    should not be to hard to investigate the source of your mistake.

commit 56c927d6e9fb73027d485ba7a5ecde468fba24fc
Merge: a1ad64d3a 5198aead0
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Thu Dec 31 20:44:36 2015 +0100

    Merge pull request #789 from RubenVerborgh/fix-memoize-checksum-calculation
    
    Avoid double calculation of checksum

commit 5198aead0c87df45600478d2ed2473afeb5c3442
Author: Ruben Verborgh <ruben@verborgh.org>
Date:   Thu Dec 31 17:19:17 2015 +0100

    Memoize checksum calculation.
    
    The new checksum of objects used to be calculated twice:
    1. for checksums_available?
    2. for checksums_identical?
    Since checksum calculation can be costly, we memoize its calculation.

commit 6f268f4b7e9b783b846189cd353eb2b6dc60d4d8
Author: Micha Rosenbaum <micha@rosetree.de>
Date:   Wed Nov 4 09:09:29 2015 +0100

    Add DateTime handling to attribute_to_time
    
    This enhances `attribute_to_time` which previously removed all time
    information from a DateTime. This happened because DateTime identifies
    itself as a Date.
    
        2.2.3 :001 > require 'date'
         => true
        2.2.3 :002 > DateTime.now.is_a?(Date)
         => true
    
    Up to now, if `time.is_a?(Date)` is true, `attribute_to_time` will
    create a new Time, with just year, month and day set. To fix that
    behaviour, this commit adds a new condition at the beginning of
    `attribute_to_time`, which uses `time.to_time` as long as `time` is a
    DateTime.

commit 107897fb8f9544fa6611b34305b1fec045997452
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Fri Jun 19 09:39:22 2015 +0200

    Remove Inch badge
    
    nanoc is a tool, not a library. As much as I care about documentation,
    API documentation is not where it’s at for nanoc. Because of this, I
    don’t feel that the Inch badge belongs in the nanoc README.
    
    I will continue to use Inch for other projects where it is more
    appropriate (for instance, ddfreyne/cri).
    
    CC @rrrene

Date:   Sun Apr 19 09:44:51 2015 +0200

    Merge pull request #543 from jugglinmike/mixed-content-check
    
    Implement "Mixed Content" check

commit e2d4feb54cfee11bbb576abcd6edfe0c546892fd
Author: Mike Pennisi <mike@mikepennisi.com>
Date:   Sat Apr 18 15:41:37 2015 -0400

    Implement "Mixed Content" check
    
    This check ensures that resources embedded within HTML documents are not
    requested using a protocol that degrades the security of the original
    connection. This avoids "mixed content" warnings in browsers that
    enforce consistent protocols, and it precludes the leaking of private
    information in browsers that do not.

    Take Rouge class from pre rather than code
    
    Rouge’s HTML formatter was changed so that the class appears on the
    `pre` element rather than the `code` element.
    
    See also jneen/rouge#191.

commit f8ec1643adfb0601038d017d0d82f40973592e0f
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sun Nov 23 20:49:35 2014 +0100

    Fix many Rubocop offenses
    
    This is the second part of my crusade against non-standard code style;
    the first part being #476. There are two reasons why these changes were
    not in #476:
    
    1. Rubocop got updated with a lot of new checks, and this PR ensures we
       adhere to the guidelines set forth in that new Rubocop.
    
    2. I got over the attachment to my personal preferences (such as TODO’s
       not being postfixed by a colon).

commit aeb71156d6a97851f9f262ae68eb09074432b314
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sat Sep 6 11:11:59 2014 +0200

    Use #rm_rf rather than #remove_entry_secure
    
    On some systems, `FileUtils#remove_entry_secure` fails to work because
    it fails the [TOCTTOU vulnerability check](1), even for `/tmp`. In the
    case of nanoc, the vulnerability check has little use, since it deletes
    the directories that it creates itself, so using `FileUtils#rm_rf`
    instead of `FileUtils#remove_entry_secure` is fine.
    
    Also see nanoc/nanoc#465
    
    [1]: http://www.ruby-doc.org/stdlib-2.1.2/libdoc/fileutils/rdoc/FileUtils.html#method-c-remove_entry_secure

commit d7a9b7e87eb455c00881fae5a2393c9ec5e8fbb9

commit bb4a6c01e8f9a932c88950a872d51c079b5f5791
Author: Mike Pennisi <mike@mikepennisi.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 9 18:56:41 2014 -0400

    Support filtering Items Arrays by Regex
    
    This is a convenience API for working with the `@items` array in nanoc's
    `preprocess` block. In that context, it is common to manipulate items
    according to a shared part of their identifier.
    
    For example, with this change in place, users could succinctly create a
    collection of all authors for a given site's weblog:
    
        @items[%r{^/weblog/authors/}].each { |author|
          # etc...
        }

commit 13bf41c7558931be0c17930c5fb0120dbc6c127c
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Mon Apr 21 19:32:24 2014 +0200

    Fix broken XSLT stylesheet
    
    XSLT stylesheets that use variable names must define the variables.
    libxml appears to be too permissive and allow broken stylesheets, while
    JRuby-Nokogiri correctly fails to parse the stylesheet.
    
    For details, see the following analysis of this issue by @headius:
    https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/1078#issuecomment-40936310
    
    This test still fails due to a missing <?xml> header. For details, see
    https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/1079

Date:   Mon Apr 21 19:31:52 2014 +0200

    With C extensions disabled, a bunch of dependencies failed to compile.

commit 8843d302ea60c5631db0e0b341bae43eec17f45d
Merge: 8a8d398f6 6ef2e876b
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sat Mar 22 11:49:30 2014 +0100

    Merge pull request #404 from simonsouth/bug/make-xsl-filter-honor-omit-xml-declaration
    
    Honor "omit-xml-declaration" in XSL stylesheets - issue #403

commit 6ef2e876b41047d212344c51e7ffed8fa24a7ccc
Author: Simon South <ssouth@simonsouth.com>
Date:   Mon Mar 17 21:34:15 2014 +0800

    Honor "omit-xml-declaration" in XSL stylesheets
    
    Setting "omit-xml-declaration='yes'" in an XSL stylesheet is
    supposed to suppress the XML declaration ("<?xml... ?>") at the top
    of the generated output. However, this setting was being ignored by
    nanoc's XSL filter, which caused problems when it was used to
    generate XML fragments for inclusion in other layouts.
    
    The problem was that Nokogiri was being invoked in a way that
    returned an object representing the transformed XML document.
    Fetching the string representation of this document then naturally
    caused a fresh XML declaration to be generated.
    
    This change makes the filter retrieve from Nokogiri the raw text of
    the transform's output so that any omitted elements remain omitted.

commit 8a8d398f66b2994749d35f199b983709d7c72fae

Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>

commit d7e25fdbd761dcccff308426ed94264b3329782c
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>

    Add XSL filter bug fix to release notes

commit 6e558dd34b58d842889668cd5d1f70666452cbba
Merge: 45e96ea2f 9674dd23a
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sat Mar 15 14:14:55 2014 +0100

    Merge pull request #401 from simonsouth/bug/make-xsl-filter-process-item-content
    
    Make XSL filter transform the item, not the layout - issue #399

commit 9674dd23a7c80bf1c665d1d349a671ed4741797d
Author: Simon South <ssouth@simonsouth.com>
Date:   Sat Mar 15 18:45:18 2014 +0800

    Make XSL filter transform the item, not the layout
    
    Previously the XSL filter used the value of the "content" parameter
    passed to the "run" method as the content to transform. But when
    invoked as a layout, filters are passed the content of the _layout_
    in this parameter, not the content of the item. As this filter can
    only be invoked as a layout it did not work as expected.
    
    This change modifies the filter to use the value of the ":content"
    parameter passed to the class at initialization as the content to
    transform, consistent with how layouts are invoked. It also updates
    the filter's test cases to reflect how the filter is actually used
    and to ensure the correct input is being transformed.

commit 3c7bfbebaf7c42833c6333708b7c8fcf098bcc45
Author: Raphael von der Grün <raphinesse@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Nov 21 20:03:43 2013 +0100

    Exclude problematic gems on Windows
    
    * Newer versions of `bluecloth` [do not compile on Windows][1] out of the box
    * `handlebars` depends directly on `therubyracer` which in turn depends on `libv8` which [does not compile on Windows][2] out of the box either
    
    [1]: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4932221/bluecloth-v2-0-10-with-windows-7-not-working
    [2]: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10812696/problems-with-jslint-v8-ruby-gem-installation-on-windows7-64-bit/10924081#10924081

    - Correctly compose the key for the file (path/to/file rather than pathto/file)
    - Fix a bug where all files outside of the path get deleted when you deploy
    - Fix a bug where fog throws a warning about "Unrecognized arguments: path"

Date:   Sun Mar 3 23:00:42 2013 +0100

    only cache when preprocessing is ready
    
    Only cache these values if preprocessing is ready. Preprocessing is ready when the
    @items attribute is frozen.

commit 9f8e24d122cd81ed9555723004fcd8f45251f9d7
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sun Mar 3 21:47:10 2013 +0100

    Do not move files out of `content/` (fixes #271)
    
    This is not as efficient as it could be, because moving files out of the
    temporary directory into `output/` is perfectly fine. Copying binary
    items into the temporary directory just so they can be safely moved is
    also not efficient either, though.
    
    And yes, @bobthecow was right all along.

commit fa5372f18f5efeb43fe7a9f8dd1f03d3a24a3379
Author: Stefan Bühler <stbuehler@web.de>
Date:   Wed Nov 28 11:55:10 2012 +0100

    Call forget_dependencies_if_outdated in run instead of load
    
    This helps to track down the dependency that leads to outdated objects.
    
    If the dependencies are cleared in load, nanoc show-data just
    will show empty dependencies for all outdated objects.

commit f218cbcaef013b381dffc9eadbe4e2b3d972e11b
Author: Spencer Whitt <spencerlwhitt@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Jul 30 03:25:09 2012 -0400

    support for protocol-relative urls in external link checker
    
    Protocol-relative urls are of the form //example.com. They get converted
    to the form http://example.com before being run through the external
    link checker. Of course, this assumes the protocol is http, but that is a
    fairly small and safe assumption, with minimal repercussions if wrong.

commit d1fec7b3ad59275354f1b4296e72229174ef490e
Author: Spencer Whitt <spencerlwhitt@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Jul 30 01:34:51 2012 -0400

    stopped output_filenames from outputting folder names
    
    The output_filenames method of the Checker class was including folder
    paths in its output. This was causing the internal_links and external_links
    checkers to choke.

commit f0c7f92f62ca556cf6e1a6fbd757da5264155bc4
Author: Bil Bas (Spooner) <bil.bagpuss@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Jul 24 12:12:00 2012 +0100

    Fixed capturing for slim filter (fixes #127)

commit 4e9071440f13bf38ffa9192f4c41e17f2e3056b0
Author: Mathias Bynens <mathias@qiwi.be>
Date:   Fri Jul 20 12:27:54 2012 +0200

    create-site.rb: Omit optional `@type` attribute, and remove `@media`
    
    The `type=text/css` attribute/value pair for `<link rel=stylesheet>` is
    optional as per HTML5. http://mathiasbynens.be/notes/html5-levels#level-1
    
    Removing the `media=screen` attribute/value pair allows specifying the
    styles for various types of media in a single CSS file.

commit e3dd976f632a3e94832c683f85dcdf57effce56d
Author: Dan Callahan <dan.callahan@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Dec 14 01:34:01 2011 -0600

    Avoid libxml2 encoding bug.
    
    Calling inner_html= resulted in all kinds of encoding weirdness due to a bug in
    a common version of libxml2. Building a tree of nodes and using children=
    instead works properly.
    
    The bug is present in the version of libxml2 that ships with OS X Lion, so
    working around this in Nanoc itself should save a lot of users a good bit of
    trouble.
    
    References:
    https://github.com/tenderlove/nokogiri/issues/458

commit a01f5b73d215cf78441de09d0a1e437a66168b20
Author: Dan Callahan <dan.callahan@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Dec 14 01:34:01 2011 -0600

    Avoid libxml2 encoding bug.
    
    Calling inner_html= resulted in all kinds of encoding weirdness due to a bug in
    a common version of libxml2. Building a tree of nodes and using children=
    instead works properly.
    
    The bug is present in the version of libxml2 that ships with OS X Lion, so
    working around this in Nanoc itself should save a lot of users a good bit of
    trouble.
    
    References:
    https://github.com/tenderlove/nokogiri/issues/458
    
    --HG--
    extra : transplant_source : %90%02%A6%B7%F3%EF%01%E2%FA%3B%1C%B9%B5%21%F5%DF%BCF%E9m

    renamed nanoc3 to nanoc

commit 8261b08645841792f53738532cfdf6c54670e09c
Author: Matthias Vallentin <vallentin@icir.org>
Date:   Sat Jun 4 21:56:21 2011 +0200

    Allow for passing arbitrary options to pygmentize.
    The only option that could be passed to the pygmentize command line tool was
    encoding. However, there is a wealth of other options that users might want to
    provide to the command line of pygmentize. For example, this patch allows users
    to do so in the following way:
    
      filter :colorize_syntax,
             :colorizers => { :c => :pygmentize },
             :pygmentize => { :linenos => 'noclasses' }

commit 32385c0369aece9840f51976a7042f601a0f07fc
Author: Justin Hileman <justin@justinhileman.info>
Date:   Thu May 12 19:24:08 2011 +0200

    Add :items parameter for xml_sitemap
    This allows users to pre-filter items going into the sitemap, e.g.
    
        <%= xml_sitemap :items => @items.reject{ |i| i[:is_hidden] || i[:binary] } %>
    
    ... to remove binary items from the sitemap.
    ---
     lib/nanoc3/helpers/xml_sitemap.rb |   13 ++++++++++-
     test/helpers/test_xml_sitemap.rb  |   38 +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
     2 files changed, 49 insertions(+), 2 deletions(-)

commit 35dd46b6ebf66cd41b6768bd2d6ad7d1b2ee33d9
Author: Tuomas Kareinen <tkareine@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed May 4 21:08:13 2011 +0200

    Fix assert_contains_exactly to consider edge cases
    
    Fixes comparing collections that have the same elements, but different
    number of them, for example:
    
      assert_contains_exactly [ 'foo', nil, 'foo'], [nil, 'foo', nil]
    
    should fail.

commit 930a41968044bba779c710330f87e7c7812869d0
Author: Vincent Driessen <vincent@datafox.nl>
Date:   Sat Aug 7 10:29:24 2010 +0200

    Expose RedCloth params to the nanoc filter.
    
    This way, we can easily influence how RedCloth behaves.  In particular
    it's useful to be able to turn off hard line breaks, like so:
    
        compile '/' do
            filter :redcloth, :hard_breaks => false
            layout 'default'
        end

commit 35a92ed0cc50e4649f5ae9d5c5341170c51cf67e
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Fri Aug 6 10:50:59 2010 +0200

    updated CLI documentation

commit aabaff57e001c6232b4e1cf17b69d8719dddafa2
Author: Eric Sunshine <sunshine@sunshineco.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 19 20:12:05 2010 -0400

    Fixed random crashes in filesystem_unified tests on Windows.
    
    Fixed problem where leaked file-handles would randomly crash
    filesystem_unified tests on Windows.  Specifically, certain tests would
    open but not close files, and these opened files would prevent
    FileUtils.rm_rf('tmp') by test teardown from succeeding. (Windows,
    unlike Unix, will not allow a folder to be deleted if contained files
    are opened.)  Later tests, expecting very specific sets of files in
    'tmp', would then fail upon finding detritus from earlier tests. Crashes
    were essentially random due to the vagaries of garbage collection which
    would not always clean up the leaked file-handles in time for
    FileUtils.rm_rf('tmp').
    
    --HG--
    branch : 3.1.x

commit ffa54dee5b3835d67d54f7d2a1363a253746adde
Author: Eric Sunshine <sunshine@sunshineco.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 19 18:22:45 2010 -0400

    On Windows, skip tests relying upon Unix-specific facilities.
    
    On Windows, Process::getrlimit() raises NotImplementedError, and
    Process::RLIMIT_NOFILE is not defined (hence, raises NameError), thus
    skip such tests.
    
    --HG--
    branch : 3.1.x

commit 96bd70ea884e0d60312b2f8ae037097bd2dd2b41

commit 2e37d674a890575c2868a374d78dbc2cd6bed68c
Author: Eric Sunshine <sunshine@sunshineco.com>
Date:   Sun Apr 18 20:24:40 2010 -0400

    Fix checksum caching for items created dynamically by 'preprocess'.
    
    Restore @old_checksum from the cache after 'preprocess', rather than
    before, thus checksums of items created dynamically are properly
    restored.
    
    Collect new checksums at Site#store_checksums() time rather than when
    items, layouts, code snippets are loaded. Consequently, items created
    dynamically by 'preprocess' are now properly seen by
    Site#store_checksums().
    
    The patch introduces a minor semantic change in that an item's
    @old_checksum has not yet been assigned when 'preprocess' is run.
    It seems unlikely that 'preprocess' would ever access an item's
    @old_checksum, so this difference probably is insignificant.

commit 655e14288a583628b5e2ad169339a01c08d2a80b
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sun Apr 18 20:35:07 2010 +0200

commit cdb4a66323dab0744d352db11540f8c28c02f524
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Mon Feb 23 10:05:19 2009 +0100

    renamed 'path' to 'identifier' where appropriate
    
    This should clear up the confusion between the different kinds of paths. An item now has an 'identifier' instead of a path. When compiling and writing an item, it is written to its 'raw_path', but when it is linked to, the 'path' is used.

Date:   Sun Feb 22 22:01:39 2009 +0100

    code objects now consist of individual snippets
    
    This change greatly improves the quality of backtraces, because individual snippets also have a unique filename. This is more or less a temporary solution, though, since the data source should not be responsible for loading code at all (see ticket #53 on trac).

commit 1d5ed17a13f8566872d2877759e59187a1769f25
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sun Feb 15 20:16:25 2009 +0100

    added #relative_path_to method to LinkTo helper
    
    This helper method is based on the helper method by Christian Plessl. See <http://groups.google.com/group/nanoc/browse_thread/thread/b03c68d91786007b> for details.

commit 63411fa3169dab65d9e7e42c0c726dbce0590020
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Fri Feb 13 11:49:02 2009 +0100

    autocompiler now serves asset content correctly
    
    Due to the request path being cleaned (String#cleaned_path), the autocompiler would never be able to find the rep for the requested asset (because it'd end with a slash, and asset paths rarely end with a slash). Instead, the autocompiler would serve the already compiled content from a previous "nanoc co" call. Moral of the story: never use #cleaned_path on disk paths or web paths.
    
    --HG--
    branch : 2.1

commit babb1f61389003c6ab2ed48701967f53f22d9322
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Fri Feb 13 11:23:09 2009 +0100

    autocompiler now also serves a 500 when an exception occurs outside compilation
    
    --HG--
    branch : 2.1

commit 2297d573a44c103810e0a5012ad6962b4f38a3c4

    autocompiler no longer accepts broken paths
    
    --HG--
    branch : 2.1

commit d8260299e7a12bfabde56ccb752a72019a9b0bed
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Sun Dec 21 14:17:58 2008 +0100

    added dependency tracking
    
    This will not only make nanoc more intelligent when deciding which pages or assets need to be recompiled (and therefore hopefully eliminating the need for --force), but it will also speed up compiliation quite a bit, since nanoc is now able to make better decisions about which pages and assets do not have any effect on the compilation process.

commit 895f5f928abb422a508bb9f1b794d485b0e39879
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 22 18:52:12 2008 +0200

    autocompiler now serves index files instead of 404s
    
    When requesting a path for which no page/asset rep exists, the autocompiler will try to serve the path if a file exists there and the path does not end with a slash. If the path does end with a slash, it'll try to serve one of the index files instead.
    
    --HG--
    branch : 2.1

commit 0a9e66e594bd311395870ecdc6329f1c17985b2f
Author: Denis Defreyne <denis.defreyne@stoneship.org>
Date:   Wed May 14 13:59:02 2008 +0200

    updated filesystem data sources  with new CRUD methods
    
    This change required some (hopefully temporary) hacks to make things work:
    - Layout, Page and PageDefaults are now responsible for cleaning their metadata
      (Hash#clean) so the data doesn't need to.
    - Page now stores the raw attributes and raw content, because these need to be
      fetched by the data store when saving a page.

    extra : convert_revision : svn%3A177060d3-6165-4ab0-95eb-642399a075a8/nanoc/trunk%40752
